paragraph: CHAPTER 23.

Mr Seagrave was the first up on the ensuing morning; and when Ready came out of the tent, he said to him, "Do you know, Ready, I feel much happier and my mind much more at ease since I find myself here.  On the other side of the island everything reminded me that we had been shipwrecked; and I could not help thinking of home and my own country; but here we appear as if we had been long settled, and as if we had come here by choice."
tokens: first up ensuing morning ready come tent say know ready feel happy mind more ease find other side island remind shipwreck help think home own country appear settle come choice

paragraph: "I trust that feeling will be stronger every day, sir; for it's no use, and indeed sinful, to repine."
tokens: trust feeling strong day sir use sinful repine

paragraph: "I acknowledge it, and with all humility.  What is the first thing which you wish we should set about?"
tokens: acknowledge humility first thing wish set

paragraph: "I think, sir, the first object is to have a good supply of fresh water; and I therefore wish you and William--Here he is.  Good-morning, William--I was saying that I thought it better that Mr Seagrave and you should clear out the spring while I am away in the boat.  I brought another shovel with me yesterday, and you both can work; perhaps we had better go there, as Juno, I see, is getting the breakfast ready.  You observe, Mr Seagrave, we must follow up the spring till we get among the cocoa-nut trees, where it will be shaded from the sun; that is easily done by digging towards them, and watching how the water flows. Then, if you will dig out a hole large enough to sink down in the earth one of the water-casks which lie on the beach, I will bring it down with me this afternoon; and then, when it is fixed in the earth in that way, we shall always have the cask full of water for use, and the spring filling it as fast as we empty it."
tokens: think sir first object have good supply fresh water wish good morning say think good clear spring boat bring shovel yesterday work have good go see get breakfast ready observe follow spring get cocoa nut tree shade sun do digg watch water flow dig hole large sink earth water cask lie beach bring afternoon fix earth way have cask full water use spring fill empty

paragraph: "I understand," replied Mr Seagrave; "that shall be our task while you are absent."
tokens: understand reply task absent

paragraph: "Now, I have nothing more to do than to speak to Juno about dinner," replied Ready; "and then I'll just take a mouthful, and be off."
tokens: have more do speak dinner reply ready take mouthful

paragraph: Ready directed Juno to fry some pork in the frying-pan, and then to cut off some slices from the turtle, and cook turtle-steaks for dinner, as well as to warm up the soup which was left; and then, with a biscuit and a piece of beef in his hand, he went down to the boat and set off for the cove.  Mr Seagrave and William worked hard; and, by twelve o'clock, the hole was quite large and deep enough, according to the directions Ready had given.  They then left their work and went to the tent.
tokens: ready direct fry pork frying pan cut slice turtle cook turtle steak dinner warm soup leave biscuit piece beef hand go boat set cove work o'clock hole large deep accord direction ready give leave work go tent

paragraph: "You don't know how much happier I am now that I am here," said Mrs Seagrave, taking her husband's hand, as he seated himself by her.
tokens: know happy say take husband hand seat

paragraph: "I trust it is a presentiment of future happiness, my dear," said Mr Seagrave.  "I assure you that I feel the same, and was saying so to Ready this morning."
tokens: trust presentiment future happiness dear say assure feel same say ready morning

paragraph: "I feel that I could live here for ever, it is so calm and beautiful; but I miss one thing--there are no birds singing here as at home."
tokens: feel live calm beautiful miss thing be bird sing home

paragraph: "I have seen no birds except sea-birds, and of them there is plenty. Have you, William?"
tokens: see bird sea bird be plenty

paragraph: "Only once, father.  I saw a flight a long way off.  Ready was not with me, and I could not tell what they were; but they were large birds, as big as pigeons, I should think.  There is Ready coming round the point," continued William.  "How fast that little boat sails!  It is a long pull, though, for the old man when he goes to the cove."
tokens: father see flight long way ready tell large bird big pigeon think be ready come point continue little boat sail long pull old man go cove

paragraph: "Let us go down and help Ready carry up some of the things before dinner," said Mrs Seagrave.
tokens: let go help ready carry thing dinner say

paragraph: They did so; and William rolled up the empty water-cask which Ready had brought with him.
tokens: roll empty water cask ready bring

paragraph: The turtle-steaks were as much approved of as the turtle-soup; indeed, after having been so long on salt meat, a return to fresh provisions was delightful.
tokens: turtle steak approve turtle soup salt meat return fresh provision delightful

paragraph: "And now to finish our well," said William, as soon as dinner was over.
tokens: finish say dinner

paragraph: "How hard you do work, William!" said his mother.
tokens: hard do work say mother

paragraph: "So I ought, mother.  I must learn to do everything now."
tokens: mother learn do

paragraph: "And that you will very soon," said Ready.
tokens: say ready

paragraph: They rolled the cask to the spring, and, to their astonishment, found the great hole which they had dug not two hours before quite full of water.
tokens: roll cask spring astonishment find great hole dig hour full water

paragraph: "Oh dear," said William, "we shall have to throw all the water out to get the cask down."
tokens: dear say have throw water get cask

paragraph: "Think a little, William," said Mr Seagrave, "for the spring runs so fast that it will not be an easy task.  Cannot we do something else?"
tokens: think little say spring run easy task do else

paragraph: "Why, father, the cask will float, you know," replied William.
tokens: father cask float know reply

paragraph: "To be sure it will as it is; but is there no way of making it sink?"
tokens: sure be way make sink

paragraph: "Oh yes.  I know--we must bore some holes in the bottom, and then it will fill and sink down of itself."
tokens: know bear hole bottom fill sink

paragraph: "Exactly," replied Ready.  "I expected that we should have to do that, and have the big gimlet with me."
tokens: reply ready expect have do have big gimlet

paragraph: Ready bored three or four holes in the bottom of the cask, and as it floated the water ran into it, and by degrees it gradually sank down. As soon as the top of the cask was level with the surface they filled in all round with the spade and shovel, and the well was completed.
tokens: ready bored hole bottom cask float water run degree sink top cask level surface fill spade shovel complete
